20110128190429.000|20110128190431.000|TR0|President Mubarak has been so hesitant to

20110128190534.000|20110128190536.000|TR0|in just a matter of four days, it's come 
20110128190536.000|20110128190539.000|TR0|to this, where the Egyptian government,

20110128190803.000|20110128190806.000|TR0|about it a number of times today, but it 
20110128190806.000|20110128190808.000|TR0|really illustrates I think that turning 
20110128190808.000|20110128190810.000|TR0|point where the police realized that they 
20110128190810.000|20110128190812.000|TR0|couldn't face off against the

20110128190819.000|20110128190821.000|TR0|When one of the demonstrators stood 
20110128190821.000|20110128190824.000|TR0|between the rock-throwing crowd and the 
20110128190824.000|20110128190826.000|TR0|rock-throwing police with his hands in the 
20110128190826.000|20110128190828.000|TR0|air, it calmed the situation down.  More 
20110128190828.000|20110128190830.000|TR0|protesters came in doing the same thing.
20110128190830.000|20110128190833.000|TR0|
20110128190833.000|20110128190835.000|TR0|Young men tried to throw rocks.  They were 
20110128190835.000|20110128190837.000|TR0|calmed down.  And then they were standing 
20110128190837.000|20110128190840.000|TR0|side by side with police, patting them on 
20110128190840.000|20110128190842.000|TR0|the back.
20110128190842.000|20110128190844.000|TR0|
20110128190844.000|20110128190846.000|TR0|But they couldn't stop the crowd throwing 
20110128190846.000|20110128190849.000|TR0|rocks, so it carried on and the police 
20110128190849.000|20110128190851.000|TR0|pulled back.  And that was sort of a real 
20110128190851.000|20110128190853.000|TR0|moment of turning.
20110128190853.000|20110128190855.000|TR0|
20110128190855.000|20110128190858.000|TR0|And then, earlier in the evening, almost a 
20110128190858.000|20110128190900.000|TR0|vacuum where the police had gone.  They 
20110128190900.000|20110128190902.000|TR0|had been beaten off the streets.  The 
20110128190902.000|20110128190904.000|TR0|protesters didn't know what to do.  They 
20110128190904.000|20110128190907.000|TR0|started burning buildings, police stations.
20110128190907.000|20110128190909.000|TR0|
20110128190909.000|20110128190911.000|TR0|And there very much appeared to be a 
20110128190911.000|20110128190913.000|TR0|vacuum of decision as well before the army 
20110128190913.000|20110128190916.000|TR0|came in, as they are now.  And this whole 
20110128190916.000|20110128190918.000|TR0|sort of decision-making process is wait 
20110128190918.000|20110128190920.000|TR0|for President Mubarak to speak.  It's sort 
20110128190920.000|20110128190922.000|TR0|of reflected here on the streets.
20110128190922.000|20110128190925.000|TR0|
20110128190925.000|20110128190927.000|TR0|Who's leading, under whose direction?  I 
20110128190927.000|20110128190929.000|TR0|think a lot of people on the streets here 
20110128190929.000|20110128190931.000|TR0|are wondering that.
20110128190931.000|20110128190934.000|TR0|
20110128190934.000|20110128190936.000|TR0|Very strong questions going on between the 
20110128190936.000|20110128190938.000|TR0|people and the army. The army saying 
20110128190938.000|20110128190941.000|TR0|they're here to protect them.  The people 
20110128190941.000|20110128190943.000|TR0|saying, yes, that's very good, but at the 
20110128190943.000|20110128190945.000|TR0|same time, saying, you can't be here for 
20110128190945.000|20110128190947.000|TR0|President Mubarak, we want him gone.  But 
20110128190947.000|20110128190950.000|TR0|there's a very sort of apparent vacuum of 
20110128190950.000|20110128190952.000|TR0|direction of leadership at the moment -- 
20110128190952.000|20110128190954.000|TR0|Jim and Hala.
20110128190954.000|20110128190956.000|TR0|
20110128190956.000|20110128190959.000|TR0|GORANI:  And it's the same -- Nic, this is 
20110128190959.000|20110128191001.000|TR0|Hala.  And it's the same thing with the 
20110128191001.000|20110128191003.000|TR0|protesters, right?  Because it's sort of a 
20110128191003.000|20110128191005.000|TR0|diverse group of people.  It's rather 
20110128191005.000|20110128191008.000|TR0|eclectic, frankly, now that the Muslim 
20110128191008.000|20110128191010.000|TR0|Brotherhood has joined in, because you 
20110128191010.000|20110128191012.000|TR0|have sort of the higher socioeconomic 
20110128191012.000|20110128191014.000|TR0|classes, you have younger, poorer people,

20110128193057.000|20110128193100.000|TR0|significant because they are defying a
